intro: Narcissus poeticus subsp. poeticus, commonly known as the poet's daffodil, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its striking yellow petals and a single, upright central stamen. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and blooms in early spring. Its flowers are often associated with poetic symbolism and have been cultivated for their ornamental value. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, elongated petals and a strong, sweet fragrance.
